stories.original_headline: Scientists discover what’s linking floods and droughts across the planet
stories.original_summary: Scientists tracking Earth’s water from space discovered that El Niño and La Niña are synchronizing floods and droughts across continents. stories.fantasy_headline: Wizards Uncover Secret of Global Water Cycle
stories.fantasy_story: Alchemists in high towers, using arcane scrying pools, have divined a new understanding of the world's waters. They found that two great elemental spirits, known as the "Warm Breath" and the "Cool Whisper," cause synchronized floods and droughts across distant lands. When these spirits stir, some realms become drenched while others wither, revealing a powerful magical connection.

stories.original_headline: This new sugar tastes like the real thing without the usual downsides
stories.original_summary: Scientists at Tufts have found a way to turn common glucose into a rare sugar that tastes almost exactly like table sugar—but with far fewer downsides. stories.fantasy_headline: Enchanted Sugar Offers Sweetness Without Ills
stories.fantasy_story: The skilled Alchemists of the Tufts Academy have brewed a remarkable new sweetening powder. They've discovered how to transform common sweetening agents into an enchanted sugar, tasting just like the beloved old kind but without its common ailments. Using tiny, enchanted sprites as their workforce, this wondrous new concoction can now be made easily and affordably for all.

stories.original_headline: PC shipments just grew unexpectedly amid RAM shortages
stories.original_summary: The PC market is bracing for a turbulent year ahead, but shipments managed to exceed expectations in the recent holiday quarter. stories.fantasy_story: Despite prophecies of a challenging year, the Guild of Scribes and Artificers saw an unexpected boom in their enchanted scroll deliveries during the recent Winter Festival. Deliveries of magical calculating devices rose by nearly a tenth, even amidst a scarcity of vital memory crystals. It seems the Grand Architect of Silver Gate ending support for ancient operating runes sparked this sudden interest.

stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Scrying Lens Will No Longer Gaze
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Architect of Silver Gate has announced that the "Arcane Eye of the Scribe Guild," a beloved enchanted looking glass, will soon cease to function on many handheld scrying mirrors. After the ninth day of the Second Moon, its magic will fade, with all support ending by the ninth day of the Third Moon. Fear not, for its image-capturing enchantments live on within the Grand Architect's Shared Archive.
